title: Hewlet
author: Hewlet
content: Sometimes I go see people when de into the tech sector dem de organise event to take yarn so many matters when de sup for there field and during this programme , the younger people for the sector go take meet there snr bross and dem go organise ogbonge seminar when go help motivate the younger ones and also share best practices for the sector and e get one when I follow enter, after I come back e change so many things about me as e come motivate me to see say I need put in serious effort to take follow up the trend in the design field I know say this local board done really try to unite us and from the way our snr bross dem de take contribute for the forum na serious motivation to us when face never show to put in more effort to ensure say wetin we de create de of high quality but as e take concern if e de necessary to get physical meetup where we go fit;1. Building a physical community of bitcoineers so we fit talk about the trends and share ideas on the possibility of adopting bitcoin for we country 2. We fit still use am share knowledge so the younger ones for this sector fit learn and we fit also still use the medium network small.3. Organise seminars when fit focus on global trends and also share opportunities in the bitcoin world.I no know if this one go de reasonable for us oh, I say make I yarn am so we fit put mouth reason am together.

comments.body: You know its not feasible for us to all come together aside the fact that some of us would love their privacy, we live in different states and so this makes it hard for such meet up, seems like some members in some certain state has a physical meet up one time.Your 2 and 3 points are good but something we are already doing here so there is no need for the stress of making physical meet up and not all will be able to attend especially the beginners who will need the teaching so here is better

comments.author: Agbamoni
comments.body: Privacy is something many people in our industry take very seriously. They respect the privacy of others and are reluctant to jeopardize their privacy. You've raised some valid points to consider, but I don't think it's acceptable. If we want to share knowledge, we can do so personally with the individuals we want to share it with, whether they are younger or older. This is because Bitcoin is not yet fully accepted as legal tender in Nigeria. The government has imposed various bans and increased taxes on traders. Bitcoin is still considered illegal in Nigeria, which is why gatherings involving Bitcoin are not permitted. Let's continue to play it safe and observe the development of Bitcoin in our country before implementing the actions you mentioned. I can gather a lot of information about any active member on the local board without meeting them in person. So, if it's about sharing knowledge with members here, there's no need to do it physically; it's already happening here, even right now.

comments.author: adultcrypto
comments.body: Meet ups no be something new for Bitcoin community and e no take away the privacy wey Bitcoin represent. Nothing stop people wey share something in common like Bitcoin, from coming together. Na another way to bond and support one another, share idea and also see wetin life dey talk outside the forum. So far as say wey no dey do illigal for here, me no really see anything bad inside am. Me dey even happy anytime I see my fellow people wey dey for Bitcoin

comments.author: Promocodeudo
comments.body: Well said op, you have touched me with your extensive writing, and your suggestion is good, I want you to know that we have many people here and our ideas differ, some individuals you see here prefer a private life, they won't like the idea of involving themselves in open stuff, but my brother whatever you feel that's bothering in respect to Bitcoin, just feel free to share it here, people will respond to it, you never can tell through replies you might get the solution you desire, this is a community for discussion, you have the right to express yourself, no one will hold you back, just do what you can learn as fast as you can, I believe soon you will adapt here.
